title: 22 traders die in Kebbi auto crash, buried in mass grave
text:
Home » News » 22 traders die in Kebbi auto crash, buried in mass grave 22 traders die in Kebbi auto crash, buried in mass grave On 4:03 am In News by Okogba Comments 
T wenty-two traders have died in a motor accident on the Tunga Giwa-Ruwa Road in Shanga Local Government Area of Kebbi State. 
The accident occurred when a Toyota Canter vehicle that tried to avoid a pot hole, hit a motorcyclist and somersaulted, killing the cyclist and 22 passengers in the van. 
Gov Bagudu 
Sole Administrator of Shanga, Alhaji Garba Salihu, told Governor Atiku Bagudu, that the traders were returning from Tungan Giwa Market when the incident happened. 
Salihu said the vehicle rolled into a ditch and caught fire. 
He said 22 persons on board the vehicle died on the spot, while eight sustained injuries and were taken to Yauri General Hospital. 
Bagudu, who was on a visit to the area, participated in the funeral prayer for the victims, who were buried in a mass grave. 
He sympathised with the survivors and pledged to settle their medical bills and render further assistance.
